properties.Name: Ume Tange
properties.Bio: Born in Kagoshima Prefecture, Ume Tange graduated at the top of her class from Kagoshima Prefectural Normal School and became an elementary school teacher. In 1901, she entered the Department of Home Economics at Japan Women's University as one of its first students. After graduation, she worked as an assistant at the Japan Women's University under Nagayoshi Nagai, known as the father of pharmacology in Japan. She was the first woman to pass the Ministry of Education's Secondary Chemistry Teacher Licensing Examination. She entered Tohoku Imperial University together with Chika Kuroda and Raku Makita, becoming one of the first female university students in Japan. After graduating from Tohoku Imperial University, she entered the graduate school and then went on to study in the United States. She received her Ph.D. in sterol research from Johns Hopkins University. After returning to Japan, while teaching as a professor at her alma mater, Tokyo Women’s Higher Normal School, she continued her research under Umetaro Suzuki of the Institute of Physical and Chemical Research (RIKEN) and received her doctorate in agriculture from Tokyo Imperial University in 1940 for her research on vitamins.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 鹿児島県生まれの丹下ウメは、鹿児島県立女子師範学校を卒業したのち、尋常小学校の教師となった。1901年、丹下は日本女子大学に家政科の一回生として入学。卒業後は同校に残り、長井長義（薬学・化学）の助手として勤務しながら勉強を続け、女性として初めて、文部省化学中等教員検定試験に合格した。その後、丹下は黒田チカ、牧田らくと共に東北帝国大学に入学し、日本初の女子大学生の一人となった。学部の卒業後には大学院に進み、さらに米国へ留学。ジョンズ・ホプキンス大学より、ステロールの研究で博士号を授与された。帰国後には教授として母校の東京女子高等師範学校で教えるとともに、理化学研究所の鈴木梅太郎のもとで研究を継続し、1940年にビタミンの研究によって東京帝国大学から農学の博士号を受けた。

properties.Name: Katsuko Saruhashi
properties.Bio: A native of Tokyo, Saruhashi was a member of the first class of physics students at the Imperial Women's College of Science. She made world-class achievements in the field of geochemistry and was one of the founders of the Society of Japanese Women Scientists, established in 1958.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 猿橋勝子は東京出身。帝国女子理学専門学校の一期生として物理学を学んだ。地球化学の分野で世界的な業績を上げるとともに、1958年の日本婦人科学者の会の設立に携わった。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 帝国女子理学専門学校

properties.Name: Yayoi Yoshioka
properties.Bio: Yayoi Yoshioka was born in 1871 in Tōtōmi Province, which is now Shizuoka Prefecture. Yoshioka entered Saisei Gakusha in 1889 and passed the medical licensing examination in 1892. When her alma mater began to refuse admission to women because it believed that co-education would disrupt school morals, she felt the need for a medical school for women only and founded Tokyo Women's Medical School in 1900. Yoshioka's goal was to give women the economic power to improve their status.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 吉岡弥生は、1871年に現在の静岡県の一部である遠江国に生まれた。1889年に済生学舎に入学し、1892年に医師開業試験に合格。その後、済生学舎が「共学では風紀が乱れる」として女子学生の入学を拒否し始めたことを知ると、女性のための医学校の必要性を感じ、1900年に東京女医学校を設立した。吉岡は、女性が働いて経済力を得られるようにすることで、日本社会での女性の地位向上を目指した。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 済生学舎／日本医科大学

properties.Name: Kono Yasui
properties.Bio: Kono Yasui was the first female researcher in Japan to earn a doctorate. Yasui was born in Kagawa Prefecture in 1880. She graduated from the women's department of Kagawa Normal School, went on to Women’s Higher Normal School, and worked as a teacher for three years after graduation. In 1905, when a graduate course was established at Women's Higher Normal School, she majored in zoology and botany there. After graduation, she became an assistant professor at the school and a role model for young female students who wanted to pursue a career in science.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 保井コノは、日本人女性として初めて博士号を取得した科学者である。保井は1880年に香川県に生まれた。香川県師範学校女子部を経て、女子高等師範学校に入学、卒業後は3年間教師として奉職した。1905年に女子高等師範学校に研究科が設置されると、進学して動物学と植物学を学んだ。研究科修了後には、同校の助教授となり、科学の道を志す若い女性たちのロールモデルとなった。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子高等師範学校

properties.Name: Hideru Suzuki
properties.Bio: Hideru Suzuki was born in Aichi Prefecture in 1888. She majored in physics, chemistry, and mathematics at Japan Women's College, graduating in 1910. Suzuki remained at the school as an assistant to Nagayoshi Nagai, Japan's first male doctor of pharmacy and professor of chemistry at Japan Women's College. In addition to her day job, she carried out research on her own, studied German and pharmacognosy in the evenings, and passed the pharmacist's examination. Her efforts paid off when she was given the opportunity to study under Heizaburo Kondo at Tokyo Imperial University, and in 1937, at the age of 49, she became the first Japanese female doctor of pharmacy.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 鈴木ひでるは1888年愛知県生まれ。日本女子大学で物理学、化学、数学を学び、1910年に卒業した。卒業後も鈴木は同校に残り、日本初の薬学博士で同校で化学の教授を務めていた長井長義の助手として働いた。仕事に加えて研究にも取り組み、夜にはドイツ語や生薬学を学んで、薬剤師試験に合格した。その後、東京帝国大学の近藤平三郎教授のもとで研究する機会を得、1937年、49歳の時に、日本人女性で初めての薬学博士となった。

properties.Name: Michiyo Tsujimura
properties.Bio: Michiyo Tsujimura, the first female doctor of agriculture, is known for her achievements in the study of green tea. Tsujimura was born in Saitama Prefecture in 1888. After working as a teacher at an elementary school, she studied at Tokyo Prefectural Women's Normal School and then at Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School. At the Women's Higher Normal School, Tsujimura was taught by Kono Yasui and developed a strong interest in research. After graduation, Tsujimura worked as a teacher in Kanagawa and Saitama for seven years before deciding to pursue research.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 辻村みちよは、日本人女性で初めて農学分野の博士号を取得した科学者であり、緑茶の研究で知られる。辻村は1888年に埼玉県で生まれた。小学校で教師として働いたのち、辻村は東京府立師範学校、続けて東京女子高等師範学校で学んだ。東京女子高等師範学校では、保井コノの薫陶を受け、研究への強い関心を抱いた。卒業後、神奈川と埼玉で教師として7年間働いたのち、辻村は研究の道を歩みだした。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子高等師範学校

properties.Name: Raku Makita
properties.Bio:
Raku Makita was born in Kyoto. She cultivated an interest in mathematics while attending Kyoto Prefectural Girls' High School and eventually entered Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School. She graduated in 1911 with recommendations to enter the graduate course. In August 1913, after completing the graduate course and becoming a contract instructor, she took the entrance examination for the Department of Mathematics at Tohoku Imperial University, becoming the first female university student in Japan, along with Chika Kuroda and Ume Tange. In May 1916, she graduated from Tohoku Imperial University and returned to her alma mater as a mathematics instructor. 
At the same time, she met a promising artist of the time, Heizo Kanayama, and they were married in 1919. In the same year, she became a professor at Tokyo Woman's Higher Normal School, but quickly began to feel the limits of balancing being a researcher and educator with being a painter's wife. She resigned from the position in the same year.
properties.Bio_Jpn:
牧田らくは京都市生まれ。京都府高等女学校時代に数学への興味を抱き、東京女子高等師範学校に進学した。卒業後には同校研究科への進学を薦められる。研究科修了後の1913年8月、東京女子高等師範学校で嘱託教員として働いていた牧田は、東北帝国大学理科大学の数学科を受験。黒田チカ、丹下ウメとともに、日本初の女子大学生となった。1919年5月に大学を卒業すると、東京女子高等師範学校に講師として復帰した。
その後、牧田は新進気鋭の画家・金山平三と出会い、1919年に結婚。1920年には牧田は教授となったものの、教育・研究の仕事と妻としての役割の両立に限界を感じ、同年に辞職した。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子高等師範学校

properties.Name: Chika Kuroda
properties.Bio: Chika Kuroda was one of the first women in Japan to receive a bachelor's degree and was an accomplished researcher in the field of chemistry. Kuroda was born in Saga Prefecture in 1884. After graduating from the women's department of Saga Normal School, she worked as a teacher for a year before entering Women's Higher Normal School in Tokyo, which was the highest academic institution for women at the time. By the time she graduated, she had developed an interest in chemistry and wanted to further her education. In 1913, Tohoku Imperial University decided to accept women for the first time, and Kuroda passed the entrance exam along with Ume Tange and Raku Makita. At Tohoku Imperial University, she studied shikonin under the guidance of Toshiyuki Majima. Kuroda continued her research after graduation and received her doctorate in 1929.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 黒田チカは、日本で初めて学士号を取得した女性たちの一人であり、化学の分野で活躍した研究者である。黒田は1884年に佐賀県で生まれた。佐賀師範学校女子部を卒業すると、黒田は教師として1年奉職したのち、東京の女子高等師範学校に入学した。卒業までに黒田は化学への関心を深め、さらなる学びの機会を求めた。1913年に東北帝国大学が大学として初めて女性の受け入れを決めると、黒田は丹下うめ、牧田らくと共に入学試験を受験し合格した。東北帝国大学では、真島利行の下で紫紺の色素の研究を行った。大学卒業後も研究を続け、1929年に博士号を授与された。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子高等師範学校

properties.Name: Toshiko Yuasa
properties.Bio: Toshiko Yuasa was an internationally active female physicist based in France. She was born in Tokyo in 1909. She entered Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School and then the physics department of Tokyo University of Literature and Sciences, from which she graduated in 1934 before embarking on a career in physics. However, discrimination against women was severe, and it was difficult for her to obtain the kind of research opportunities she wished for. At the time, Frédéric and Irène Joliot-Curie were discovering artificial radioactivity in France, and Yuasa was so impressed by their paper that she decided to go to France. In 1940, she began her nuclear research under Frédéric Joliot-Curie at the Collège de France and received her doctorate in 1943.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 湯浅敏子は、フランスを拠点に国際的に活躍した物理学者である。湯浅は1909年に東京に生まれた。東京女子高等師範学校、続けて東京文理科大学に進学し、大学を1934年に卒業すると、物理学分野でキャリアを歩み始めた。しかし、女性差別が強固であった当時、自分の望むような研究機会を得ることは難しかった。そのころ、湯浅はフランスのレデリック・ジョリオ＝キュリーとイレーヌ・ジョリオ＝キュリー夫妻の人口放射能に関する研究に感銘を受け、フランス行きを決意した。1940年、湯浅はコレージュ・ド・フランスのフレデリック・ジョリオ＝キュリーの下で原子核研究を開始し、1943年に博士号を取得した。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子高等師範学校

properties.Name: Sechi Kato
properties.Bio: Born in Yamagata Prefecture, Sechi Kato studied at the Department of Agriculture at Hokkaido University while working as a teacher before joining the Institute of Physical and Chemical Research (RIKEN) in 1922. She was assigned to a chemical analysis laboratory but became interested in quantum mechanics and moved in and out of physics-related laboratories to study spectroscopy. Once she realized that absorption spectra could be applied to chemical analysis, she vigorously analyzed the absorption spectra of various substances and successively clarified their chemical structures and relationships to chemical reactions. Her achievements were internationally recognized, and in 1953, she became the first woman to be appointed as a principal investigator at RIKEN.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 山形県出身の加藤セチは、教師として働きながら北海道帝国大学農科大学で学び、1922年に理化学研究所に入所した。分析化学の研究室に配属されたものの、量子力学に関心を持つようになり、物理学系の研究室に出入りし、分光学を学んだ。加藤は吸収スペクトルが化学分析に応用できることに気づくと、さまざまな物質の吸収スペクトルを精力的に分析し、化学構造や化学反応との関連を次々に明らかにした。こうした業績は国際的に認められ、1953年には、加藤は理化学研究所で女性として初めて主任研究員となった。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子高等師範学校

properties.Name: Kimiko Anno
properties.Bio: Kimiko Anno was born in Yamaguchi Prefecture and graduated from Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School in 1932 followed by Tokyo University of Literature and Science in 1937. Interested in natural products chemistry, Anno entered the graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University in 1938, where she studied under Teijiro Yabuta. After completing graduate school, she became a professor at her alma mater, Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 阿武喜美子は山口県生まれ。1932年に東京女子高等師範学校を卒業し、続いて1937年に東京文理科大学を卒業した。天然有機化合物に関心を抱いていた阿武は、1938年に東京帝国大学の大学院に進学し、藪田貞治郎の指導を受けた。大学院を修了すると、母校の東京女子高等師範学校の教授となった。無脊椎動物や下等脊椎動物の結合組織のムコ多糖に関する研究から多くの新しいコンドロイチンポリ硫酸やキチン硫酸を発見したことで知られる。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子高等師範学校

properties.Name: Hideru Suzuki
properties.Bio: Hideru Suzuki was born in Aichi Prefecture in 1888. She majored in physics, chemistry, and mathematics at Japan Women's College, graduating in 1910. Suzuki remained at the school as an assistant to Nagayoshi Nagai, Japan's first male doctor of pharmacy and professor of chemistry at Japan Women's College. In addition to her day job, she carried out research on her own, studied German and pharmacognosy in the evenings, and passed the pharmacist's examination. Her efforts paid off when she was given the opportunity to study under Heizaburo Kondo at Tokyo Imperial University, and in 1937, at the age of 49, she became the first Japanese female doctor of pharmacy.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 鈴木ひでるは1888年愛知県生まれ。日本女子大学で物理学、化学、数学を学び、1910年に卒業した。卒業後も鈴木は同校に残り、日本初の薬学博士で同校で化学の教授を務めていた長井長義の助手として働いた。仕事に加えて研究にも取り組み、夜にはドイツ語や生薬学を学んで、薬剤師試験に合格した。その後、東京帝国大学の近藤平三郎教授のもとで研究する機会を得、1937年、49歳の時に、日本人女性で初めての薬学博士となった。

properties.Name: Kono Yasui
properties.Bio: Kono Yasui was the first female researcher in Japan to earn a doctorate. Yasui was born in Kagawa Prefecture in 1880. She graduated from the women's department of Kagawa Normal School, went on to Women’s Higher Normal School, and worked as a teacher for three years after graduation. In 1905, when a graduate course was established at Women's Higher Normal School, she majored in zoology and botany there. After graduation, she became an assistant professor at the school and a role model for young female students who wanted to pursue a career in science.

properties.Cont_Name: Institute of Physical and Chemical Research
properties.Hist_Name: Institute of Physical and Chemical Research

properties.Bio: Born in Yamagata Prefecture, Sechi Kato studied at the Department of Agriculture at Hokkaido University while working as a teacher before joining the Institute of Physical and Chemical Research (RIKEN) in 1922. Her achievements were internationally recognized, and in 1953, she became the first woman to be appointed as a principal investigator at RIKEN.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 山形県出身の加藤セチは、教師として働きながら北海道帝国大学農科大学で学び、1922年に理化学研究所に入所した。分析化学の研究室に配属されたものの、量子力学に関心を持つようになり、物理学系の研究室に出入りし、分光学を学んだ。加藤は吸収スペクトルが化学分析に応用できることに気づくと、さまざまな物質の吸収スペクトルを精力的に分析し、化学構造や化学反応との関連を次々に明らかにした。こうした業績は国際的に認められ、1953年には、加藤は理化学研究所で女性として初めて主任研究員となった。

properties.Cont_Name: Institute of Physical and Chemical Research
properties.Hist_Name: Institute of Physical and Chemical Research

properties.Hist_Name: Institute of Physical and Chemical Research
properties.Name: Chika Kuroda
properties.Bio: Chika Kuroda was one of the first women in Japan to receive a bachelor's degree and was an accomplished researcher in the field of chemistry. Kuroda was born in Saga Prefecture in 1884. properties.Hist_Name: Tokyo University of Literature and Science
properties.Name: Kimiko Anno
properties.Bio: Kimiko Anno was born in Yamaguchi Prefecture and graduated from Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School in 1932 followed by Tokyo University of Literature and Science in 1937. Interested in natural products chemistry, Anno entered the graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University in 1938, where she studied under Teijiro Yabuta. After completing graduate school, she became a professor at her alma mater, Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 阿武喜美子は山口県生まれ。1932年に東京女子高等師範学校を卒業し、続いて1937年に東京文理科大学を卒業した。天然有機化合物に関心を抱いていた阿武は、1938年に東京帝国大学の大学院に進学し、藪田貞治郎の指導を受けた。大学院を修了すると、母校の東京女子高等師範学校の教授となった。無脊椎動物や下等脊椎動物の結合組織のムコ多糖に関する研究から多くの新しいコンドロイチンポリ硫酸やキチン硫酸を発見したことで知られる。

properties.Hist_Name: Tokyo University of Literature and Science
properties.Name: Toshiko Yuasa
properties.Bio: Toshiko Yuasa was an internationally active female physicist based in France. She was born in Tokyo in 1909. She entered Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School and then the physics department of Tokyo University of Literature and Sciences, from which she graduated in 1934 before embarking on a career in physics. However, discrimination against women was severe, and it was difficult for her to obtain the kind of research opportunities she wished for. At the time, Frédéric and Irène Joliot-Curie were discovering artificial radioactivity in France, and Yuasa was so impressed by their paper that she decided to go to France. In 1940, she began her nuclear research under Frédéric Joliot-Curie at the Collège de France and received her doctorate in 1943.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 湯浅敏子は、フランスを拠点に国際的に活躍した物理学者である。湯浅は1909年に東京に生まれた。東京女子高等師範学校、続けて東京文理科大学に進学し、大学を1934年に卒業すると、物理学分野でキャリアを歩み始めた。しかし、女性差別が強固であった当時、自分の望むような研究機会を得ることは難しかった。そのころ、湯浅はフランスのレデリック・ジョリオ＝キュリーとイレーヌ・ジョリオ＝キュリー夫妻の人口放射能に関する研究に感銘を受け、フランス行きを決意した。1940年、湯浅はコレージュ・ド・フランスのフレデリック・ジョリオ＝キュリーの下で原子核研究を開始し、1943年に博士号を取得した。

properties.Name: Yayoi Yoshioka
properties.Bio: Yayoi Yoshioka was born in 1871 in Tōtōmi Province, which is now Shizuoka Prefecture. Yoshioka entered Saisei Gakusha in 1889 and passed the medical licensing examination in 1892. When her alma mater began to refuse admission to women because it believed that co-education would disrupt school morals, she felt the need for a medical school for women only and founded Tokyo Women's Medical School in 1900. Yoshioka's goal was to give women the economic power to improve their status.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 吉岡弥生は、1871年に現在の静岡県の一部である遠江国に生まれた。1889年に済生学舎に入学し、1892年に医師開業試験に合格。その後、済生学舎が「共学では風紀が乱れる」として女子学生の入学を拒否し始めたことを知ると、女性のための医学校の必要性を感じ、1900年に東京女医学校を設立した。吉岡は、女性が働いて経済力を得られるようにすることで、日本社会での女性の地位向上を目指した。
properties.Hist_Name_Jpn: 東京女子医学専門学校

properties.Name: Kimiko Anno
properties.Bio: Kimiko Anno was born in Yamaguchi Prefecture and graduated from Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School in 1932 followed by Tokyo University of Literature and Science in 1937. Interested in natural products chemistry, Anno entered the graduate school of Tokyo Imperial University in 1938, where she studied under Teijiro Yabuta. After completing graduate school, she became a professor at her alma mater, Tokyo Women's Higher Normal School.
properties.Bio_Jpn: 阿武喜美子は山口県生まれ。1932年に東京女子高等師範学校を卒業し、続いて1937年に東京文理科大学を卒業した。天然有機化合物に関心を抱いていた阿武は、1938年に東京帝国大学の大学院に進学し、藪田貞治郎の指導を受けた。大学院を修了すると、母校の東京女子高等師範学校の教授となった。無脊椎動物や下等脊椎動物の結合組織のムコ多糖に関する研究から多くの新しいコンドロイチンポリ硫酸やキチン硫酸を発見したことで知られる。
